html: Devastated over yet another senseless attack at a house of worship. I condemn the cowardly shooting at the Chabad of #Poway which occurred on the last day of Passover. We must all denounce anti-Semitism & hate & do all we can to combat it. Praying for all who have been impacted.

html: My measures would: 1. Require companies to list ingredients in menstrual hygiene products. 2. Prohibit the sale of expired baby formula. 3. Require @USGAO to conduct a study assessing the effects of food additives on children’s behavior and physical health. 2/3
text:
My measures would: 

1. Require companies to list ingredients in menstrual hygiene products.

2. Prohibit the sale of expired baby formula.

3. Require @USGAO to conduct a study assessing the effects of food additives on children’s behavior and physical health. 2/3

html: “I support the Menstrual Equity for All Act and its step toward ensuring dignity and equity through access to essential menstrual hygiene products,” says @TopekaKSam of @thelohm & @cut_50.pic.twitter.com/sH4WZJE7n5
text: “I support the Menstrual Equity for All Act and its step toward ensuring dignity and equity through access to essential menstrual hygiene products,” says @TopekaKSam of @thelohm & @cut_50.pic.twitter.com/sH4WZJE7n5

html: “What I appreciate about this bill is that it’s not addressing menstrual equity in schools alone or prisons alone or for homeless populations alone. It looks at this issue as it should be addressed – holistically and for all,” says Lisa Oksala of @dcdiaperbank.pic.twitter.com/c0OWgAOdFf
text: “What I appreciate about this bill is that it’s not addressing menstrual equity in schools alone or prisons alone or for homeless populations alone. It looks at this issue as it should be addressed – holistically and for all,” says Lisa Oksala of @dcdiaperbank.pic.twitter.com/c0OWgAOdFf

html: “Period poverty impacts women on the street, in jail, the workplace, federal buildings & high schools, where women are denied free access to menstrual products. The Menstrual Equity for All Act will correct this inequity," says Dana Marlowe of @I_Support_Girls.pic.twitter.com/DUQh0ZDSo3
text: “Period poverty impacts women on the street, in jail, the workplace, federal buildings & high schools, where women are denied free access to menstrual products. The Menstrual Equity for All Act will correct this inequity," says Dana Marlowe of @I_Support_Girls.pic.twitter.com/DUQh0ZDSo3

html: "Students need free and easy access to menstrual hygiene products. Without easy access to menstrual products, girls miss critical instructional time, which can be detrimental to their academic performance,” says Natalie Baumeister, a senior at @justicehswolves.pic.twitter.com/Wq03pVJX2l
text: "Students need free and easy access to menstrual hygiene products. Without easy access to menstrual products, girls miss critical instructional time, which can be detrimental to their academic performance,” says Natalie Baumeister, a senior at @justicehswolves.pic.twitter.com/Wq03pVJX2l

html: “We’re grateful that Congresswoman Meng recognizes that menstrual equity is not only a problem that exists today, and in our own communities, but that the solution is within reach,” says Holly Seibold of @BRAWSorg.pic.twitter.com/qjIlyr2Wl1
text: “We’re grateful that Congresswoman Meng recognizes that menstrual equity is not only a problem that exists today, and in our own communities, but that the solution is within reach,” says Holly Seibold of @BRAWSorg.pic.twitter.com/qjIlyr2Wl1

html: I introduced the third amendment after there were public reports of detained parents not being able to speak with their separated children over the phone because they could not afford the above-market prices charged for such calls. #KeepFamiliesTogether 5/5
text: I introduced the third amendment after there were public reports of detained parents not being able to speak with their separated children over the phone because they could not afford the above-market prices charged for such calls. #KeepFamiliesTogether 5/5

html: My third amendment allows detained parents who have been separated from their children to make free phone calls to their kids. The measure also allows these parents to confer with counsel over the phone at no cost as well. #KeepFamiliesTogether 4/5
text: My third amendment allows detained parents who have been separated from their children to make free phone calls to their kids. The measure also allows these parents to confer with counsel over the phone at no cost as well. #KeepFamiliesTogether 4/5

html: My second amendment requires @DHSgov forms that detained individuals must sign – including those used by @ICEgov & @CBP – to be printed fully in Spanish & English. Must ensure those detained at the border & elsewhere can understand what they’re signing. #KeepFamiliesTogether 3/5
text: My second amendment requires @DHSgov forms that detained individuals must sign – including those used by @ICEgov & @CBP – to be printed fully in Spanish & English. Must ensure those detained at the border & elsewhere can understand what they’re signing. #KeepFamiliesTogether 3/5

html: Thanks @CongBoyle for introducing the Reunite Children With Their Parents Act. Proud to support this critical bill. We need to reunite the 2,300 separated children with their families. If this bill becomes law, it would require @DHSgov to reunite separated families in 60 days.

html: #Paidleavemeans access to needed time off no matter where you live or work. The #FAMILYAct would set a national standard and advance the FMLA’s vision of more equitable and family friendly workplaces. #FMLA25

html: The FMLA has meant many workers can take needed time off without having to worry about losing their jobs or health insurance. But what about those who risk financial insecurity? That’s why we need #paidleave. #FMLA25
text: The FMLA has meant many workers can take needed time off without having to worry about losing their jobs or health insurance. But what about those who risk financial insecurity? That’s why we need #paidleave. #FMLA25

html: Twenty-five years after the FMLA was signed, people need #paidleave, and a national plan like the #FAMILYAct would benefit them and their families, businesses and the economy. #Paidleave means everybody wins. #FMLA25
